dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The big empty lobby of the Mon Signor. You can tell that one point this used to be a swank place. It still is, kin It's also kinda decrepit. The concierge -- a snappy, fast talking, red-haired young woman in a blue blazer named Be stands behind the reception desk. The old man, suitcase i hand, makes a beeline through the lobby, heading toward t front door. Betty sees him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam! Hey, Sam, wait a minute!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Guy stops in his tracks and turns around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty comes from behind the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to say good-bye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uhhh, Betty. The concierge. Your  boss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Old Guy squints his eyes at the young gal.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah. Gotta light, sister? Goddam  cigar went out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She speaks to the Old Guy as she lights his cigar and he  puffs away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want you to know, from the  owner and all the staff, your fifty  years of service have been an  inspiration to us all. You're a legend  in your own time, and the Mon Signor  will never be the --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just forward my cigars, Red. (He turns around the  walks out, saying  over his shoulder) Aufwiedersehen!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty is left standing in the lobby. Ted appears behind h in his bellbody uniform, sans cap.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam the bellboy. Now there was a  man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Oh, hi, Teddy. Ready to start  the night shift?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, let me buy you a drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You wanna buy me a drink? I'm starting  my shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not an alcoholic, are you;  one drink won't kill you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They walk out of frame. In the empty frame we SUPER: NEW YEAR'S EVE 7:00 P.M.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty and Ted sit in the back room, both with drinks in t hand. This dialogue is to be delivered rapid fire, Howard Hawks style.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: After fifty years, Sam retires, and  you're taking over the night shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Correct.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're filling some mighty big shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam was a legend in the hotel  business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, I know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bellhop's bellhop.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An inspiration to us all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He ran the night desk for fifty years,  all by himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An amazing man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No desk clerk. No night man. No help.  Just fuckin' Sam, and his wits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A man alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you're gonna do the same.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted spews his drink.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't. I never worked the night  shift before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh night shift -- smight shift.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We were supposed to work it together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm having a New Year's Eve party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Since when?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Actually, I'm not having it. My  roommate is. And there's this guy.  German guy. He's gonna be there. And  so am I.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't run this place by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, sure ya can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sam ran this place by himself for  fifty years.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, and he had fifty years of  fuckin' practice, too. I haven't had  a day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, Teddy, calm down --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Don't call me Teddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, the night's cake. It's easy.  The day's when it's busy. During the  night there's nothing to do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's New Year's Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Which'll make it less busy than  normal. Ever worked on Christmas?  Unless you sell turkeys, business is  dead. You just got butterflies, that's  all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What I have ain't butterflies. I  can't handle this hotel all by myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty slows the scene down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, let's calm down a minute. Slow  it down, cool it off. Let's just  talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can say any goddamn thing you  want --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- Ted? I thought we were calming  down? I thought we were cooling off?  No hostility. Say good-bye to  hostility. We're just talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... okay... okay... I'm calm,  I'm cool, let's talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, in a nutshell, all you have to  do is hold the fort. It's New Year's  Eve. Most of the guests are going  out. You'll just be giving them a  little nod as they come staggering  in at three... four... five... in  the morning. Nobody's having any  parties, a few get-togethers, but no  parties. You got about three people  checking in tonight, that's it. The  only variable is Chester Rush in the  penthouse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Chester Rush? The guy from The Wacky  Detective?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, him and his entourage checked  in last night. They're in the  penthouse. The only reason I refer  to it as a variable is that he's a  movie star. Ya never know about movie  stars. I'm tellin' ya, Ted, it's  cake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty takes a piece of paper and writes her number down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And look, if you have any problems,  call me at the party.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted thinks about it for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: -- For fifty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fifty bucks!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're shirking your duties for this  Nazi. For that you pay a price, and  the price is fifty bucks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One, Horst is not a Nazi. Two, that's  not a fair price. You're taking  advantage of the situation. Twenty  bucks. Now, twenty bucks is a fair  price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but what you're doin' to me  ain't fair. And, you are completely  and totally taking advantage of me  and your position. So fifty bucks is  the perfect price.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty begrudgingly digs in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, but don't be a pussy. You don't  bother me unless it's an emergency.  In fact, for fifty bucks, you better  not call me unless the fuckin'  building's burning down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She gives him the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get ready to take the desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Betty leaves. Ted sits in the chair, takes another drink, and prepares  himself for the night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, the bellboy, meets his first guest of the evening, a taxi unloads her luggage. To his warm surprise, the guest a Beautiful Mediterranean Goddess (actually, we will come see she is not technically a goddess, but a High Priestes She is about 25 years old, speaks with an Italian accent is dressed in Gypsy garb. She is Athena. Ted takes Athena's luggage onto his cart. But one item in woven Moroccan bag proves to be unbearably heavy. Athena concerned as he attempts to lift it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pleeze be careful -- my God. You  have no idea...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted strains as he uses all his cojones to lift the insane heavy bag onto the cart. Athena tips the cab driver, stin The driver winces and gets in the cab. Ted has now manage with grunts and groans and strained blood vessels to put  this thing on the cart. The cab skids away. Athena looks Ted, who is out of breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm usually a good tipper, but this  one -- this cab driver -- he had  green all around him. I don't like  that in a man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted wheezes and pounds on his chest.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Green? Is that bad? Like you read  auras or something like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Something like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, well what color are you seein'  around me... how's the tip lookin?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see purple... in your face, and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As if she can't help herself, Athena's eyes are strangely drawn to his crotch. She frowns, confused by this impulse. Ted appears to be  charmingly oblivious. Athena looks back into his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...you're okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted touches his face -- as if searching for the "purple" it -- and moves the cart inside, discreetly checking out crotch and giving her a confused side glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted shifts hats to check the girl in. He checks her  reservation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Athena Z.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (scratching his head -- weird name, okay) You're booked in the Honeymoon Suite -- just one night? With all this luggage?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I will only need to stay till sunrise.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... and how will you be paying?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With gold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He looks at this wacky Gypsy chick numbly -- she pulls ou her Gold Card and smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doors open and Ted and Athena emerge upon the third f Ted follows Athena with the cart down the hallway to her  room.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE HONEYMOON SUITE DOOR
dialogues.text: Ted opens the door, then lifts the easiest bags first. In the center of the room is a Jacuzzi with hokey plastic cu poised with urns on each side. A dormant fireplace looms  beyond the still hot tub. Ted stares at the heavy bag with anxiety -- then looks in front of him to Athena as she rubs the round plastic head a little Cupid and mumbles, "Perfect." Then, arms open wide, chin lifted to heaven, eyes closed, she mumbles a faint incantation. Then she does a belly-da wiggle and turns to Ted, who is truly perplexed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- the other bag -- I need it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He starts to lift it, again straining and turning purple. laughs sickly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell you got in here, lady?  Nuclear weapons?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She relieves him of the task and effortlessly picks up th bag.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dryly) The White Cliffs of Dover.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is stunned as she slings the bag over her shoulder an pauses to pull a 10 spot out of her cleavage. She hands i to him. Ted is grateful and disoriented.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The others will be coming soon. Send  them, pleeze.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted nods, confused by "the others," and walks off with th cart. Then he turns from outside the doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh -- I forgot to show you how to  turn on the Jacuzzi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But Athena is ahead of him -- she flips a switch and wate begins to flow from the baby cupids' urns into the hot tu

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I been in dis' place many New Year's.  So... you send the others to me,  huh. Go now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As she says this, the door closes with a strange force,  shutting Ted out. Athena takes the bag to the bedroom of suite.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE SUITE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: A round bed with pink tuck'n'roll headboard. It's impossi to imagine having an orgasm in this room -- unless it wer achieved by laughing. Athena carefully removes a large, beautiful white slab of stone from her tapestry bag. She caresses it and carries like a baby to the bed and places it in the very center, head of the rock resting on dusty heart-shaped pillows. Then she removes from her bag a pink negligee and matchin high-heeled slippers. And these she places with reverence on the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On this night, oh great goddess Diana,  we restore your virgin flesh and  bring you back to real life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CLOSE ON the rock slab. We hold the artifact.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon -- I take you to the pond for a  cleansing. Well, it's a swimming  pool, but it will be under the setting  sun, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just as Ted is recovering from the mystery of this first  guest, Elspeth arrives. She has skin like marble, the body of Venus, piercing blu eyes, blond hair and is dressed all in black clothing, li Honey West in a rubber dress. She carries several bags, a a silver sword on her shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I help you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I... we... have a reservation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then she snaps, irritated, behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiva!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ANGLE ON a young punk rocker chick with long orange hair, long leather coat, wearing a tight T-shirt with studs spe "PUSSY" across her breasts. This is Kiva. Kiva is kicking the tar and nicotine outta the cigarette  machine. Just as Ted's eyes grow wide with anxiety, sever packs of smokes drop into the juvenile delinquent's hands

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wait up, gawd! I had to get supplies  for this boring ass night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ted) We have a reservation in the Honeymoon  Suite.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yeah... you must be one of "the  others." And what're you carrying --  the Rock of Gibraltar?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stares at him without humor. He fumbles for the key. walks around the desk to help her with her black crocodil luggage. Jars clang inside. He is ready to go, but Elspet turns to lecture Kiva on the hazards of smoking, as Kiva  lights up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What'd I tell you about smoking?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You smoke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's right -- I smoke, and I'm  addicted to it, and I don't want the  same thing to happen to you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in game-show host  voice) "Hello -- welcome to this week's  edition of the Hypocrite of the Year  Award --"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Kiva goes off on her impression of a game-show host,  Elspeth is growing increasingly rageful, like a mother wi an unruly child. Ted waits, luggage in hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiva! That's enough --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cuts Kiva's ramble off. Kiva blows smoke defiantly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not my mother!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why're we sleeping together?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted looks on uneasily at the relationship that is beginni to unfold here. Elspeth checks his reaction and becomes self-conscious at his scrutiny.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well... I didn't mean it... literally.  I... I happen to be the only one  who... cares about you --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But her wild child looks off, bored. Elspeth turns to Ted flustered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please -- take us to our room!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted smiles uneasily and reaches to relieve her of her swo but Elspeth quickly slams her palm on the sword and shoot him a piercing glare. He jumps back with a light nervous  laugh. He leads the way to the elevator.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE HONEYMOON SUITE DOOR
dialogues.text: The couch has been set out here in the hall, as well as c tables, lamps, and the TV. Elspeth and Kiva enter the roo Athena is gone. As Ted stumbles around the furniture in t hall, he peers in the room and see a transformation. With most of the furniture removed, candles and incense and fl are beginning to form an altar around the fireplace. But oddest of all is the pink-tinged water swirling in th Jacuzzi and pouring from the cupid urns. A sprinkle of wh powder on the carpet encircles the hot tub. Elspeth hands him a tip as he gawks at the circle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Flea powder. One of the others is  bringing her cat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted starts away again, perplexed. He turns for one last l to see Elspeth kneeling before Kiva, who sprawls on the f He shakes his head and leaves.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're gonna have to wait in the  other room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I said so.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll watch TV.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't watch TV because the noise  will interfere with our ritual.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiva looks around the room and spies the TV in the hallwa She turns to Elspeth with sarcastic concession.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay... Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elspeth bristles as the brat saunters off to the bedroom. Elspeth enters the sacred circle, stands before the altar whips out her sword, and makes a ceremonial gesture point the sword upward, perfectly centered between her breasts. Kiva, behind Elspeth's back, exits from the bedroom doorw into the hall and comes back in, lugging the TV into the  honeymoon bedroom. Elspeth kneels before the altar. Athena enters the room w the "cleansed" artifact and lays the slab in the center o the altar upon the heart-shaped pillows as Elspeth lays h sword next to the rock. The women look upon the union wit tender affection.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Soon -- our goddess will come. I  will go get her negligee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Athena stands up but her reverie is dispelled as she shri Loud TV suddenly blasts from the bedroom and Kiva the bra is trying on the pink negligee over her clothes. Athena t the negligee off the irrepressible youth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you doing! Have you no  respect -- who -- who is dis girl?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiva. My friend. Kiva, turn off the  TV! I can't leave her at home --  she's on probation and I gotta keep  an eye on her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, Elspeth, your friend cannot  stay here during the ritual. She may  be one of your kind, but she is not  one of us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stays!! Or I go -- along with my  offering!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The women have a stare-down. Then Athena calls out --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TURN OF THE FUCKING TV, MAN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in a seductive pout) Make me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elspeth becomes anxious with jealousy. Athena is exaspera as she firmly demands from Elspeth --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not forget -- I am the High  Fucking Priestess. Deal with dis  girl!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elspeth defers to Athena with remembered reverence and  respect. She bows apologetic and scurries to the bedroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (eyes lifted to heaven,  wearily) Tell me -- did we have these problems  in Salem? I don't think so...

dialogues.speaker: IN THE BEDROOM
dialogues.text: Elspeth swallows her rage and approaches the brat with a  soft touch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiva... you know what I love about  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiva smirks... yeah, she knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your sweet side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what do I get if I'm sweet?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You get whatever you want. And you  know what else I love about you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (seduced now) What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And saying this, she kisses Kiva's nose and leaves the ro Kiva is quieted now. As Elspeth closes the bedroom door, has the last word.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I saw you checking her out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kiva slinks back on the bed, put in her place -- for now.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY/EXT. ELEVATOR--DUSK
dialogues.text: The doors open and Ted pushes a cart of expensive designe luggage -- and lots of it -- behind yet another Gorgeous  Gal. This one is Jezebel, a Southern beauty, fawning over her cat, as she carries nothing else, and proceeds down t hall like a Southern princess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (talking to her cat  in baby talk) Oh you little stinker... oh you sweet  little muffin. Yes... Mama loves the  baby.

dialogues.speaker: AT THE DOOR
dialogues.text: Jezebel bursts in, chattering.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, this is just darlin'! Just  darlin' Hi-dee, girls...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted carries all her bags inside awkwardly. Again, the pla has become all the more transformed with wild canopies of exotic cloths and fixings. Elspeth and Athena are hard at work on a strange nature sculpture as Jezebel enters. She stands inside the powdered circle and before the hot tub, which now has dark blue water swirling inside. She presen her cat -- upward toward heaven -- frees the cat, bares h breasts and sucks in the vibes: "Ahhhh." Ted settles the bags down, hoping for a peek at her charm but her back is to him. The kitty rubs on her leg. She pi it up and presses it against her bare breasts, petting it sweetly. She winks and hands him a tip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Toodle-loo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And saying this, she shoos him away. Through the glass do to the bedroom, she sees Kiva sprawled on the bed, writin on herself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well -- I see Elspeth has herself a  new lil' fool -- what the hell is  she doin' here on our night of annual  ritual?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) I have sanctioned her presence, as  long as she behaves. Come on -- there  is more work to be done to welcome  our great Diana.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I WANT ROOM SERVICE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why do I always attract girls who  are looking for a babysitter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well now, honey, maybe Juvenile Hall  ain't the best place to find serious  relationship material.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Elspeth seethes at her. Jezebel acts blithely innocent.

dialogues.speaker: IN THE HALLWAY
dialogues.text: Ted is walking from the room with the cart. His face is e in a mask of perpetual frown as he looks at the tip in hi hand -- at least these lunachicks tip well. Waking him out of his deep mood is Raven. Another female  intoxication, she wears a short skirt, all done up in Nat American, Southwestern themes. No shoes. But she carries a small, old handmade broom. She moves do the hall, blissed-out. Ted makes eye contact, despite him

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm looking for the room for making  love.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You might be referring to the  Honeymoon Suite. Straight thata way...  you can't miss it -- see all that  furniture in the hallway --

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh I know the way. I just wanted you  to know that I knew where I was going  and that you needn't bother yourself  with me. The others are here -- great!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (wearily) Oh yeah -- it's so great -- it's  fantastic.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (in deep empathy) Ohhh... I know it all seems very  strange but you're coping with us  much better than the bellboys of  past New Year's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Past New Year's?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh yes -- we've been coming here  every New Year... for a long time.  Thanks for your patience.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh hey -- no problem -- wreck the  place. Bring in cats. Ruin the carpet  with flea powder, pour paint in the  Jacuzzi. Throw the furniture out  the... where're your bags?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I travel very light.

dialogues.text: The witches all incant.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So must it be. Three times three  times three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They march half-naked as they moan and revel in eerie cri The Jacuzzi begins to bubble and boil. Their cries height the potion bubbles over.

dialogues.speaker: HOURS LATER
dialogues.text: Athena reads from a huge leatherbound book, The Book of  Shadows, full of potions and spells. Four discouraged wit pack their bags. The room has been restored to its worldl under-splendor. Kiva uses the remote on the TV... so much for witchcraft. The slab of rock remains a slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't understand what went wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I say Eva pulled one over on us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Honey -- Eva was wearing the face of  someone just fucked good... and the  best actress in this world, or any  other, can't fake a thing like that!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Exactly -- if she was fucked so good,  how could she save his come?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It could be done...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Girls, knock it off. (she looks up from  the book) Maybe... maybe it needed to be the  sperm of a virgin male.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (dreamily) He was no virgin!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The witches sadly collect their things. Athena, deep in  thought, strokes the slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's leave her here, with the sword,  until dawn. I will come back for her  before checkout time. I just... feel  too sad to carry her away before the  sun comes up to warm her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all agree. They pick up their bags and head out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (cuddling her cat) I can't believe we have to carry our  own bags out! My mama would have a  hissy fit!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (flirtatiously) I'll carry your bags.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (firmly) You're carrying my bags!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They leave the room. Jezebel's cat leaps from her arms as she hoists her luggage. Eva walks out satisfied, thought  perhaps a little sore -- "ouch," she says, and smiles. At takes one last look at their goddess slab.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next year, we try again -- with virgin  sperm.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She closes the door on the Honeymoon Suite (till next New Year's Eve!). FADE TO BLACK.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted behind the desk, on the phone. We only hear his side.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, Jesus, what did I tell you? Do  you want milk and cookies, or do you  not? (pause) I can't turn on an adult station  without permission from your parents. (pause, he checks his  computer) That's not what the machine tells  me. (pause) You be good and you'll get milk and  cookies, but for now leave me alone,  please. I'll be up later to put you  both to sleep.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Goddamn kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: SUPER: 1:00 a.m. The phone rings again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Room Service.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A small party is going on. A long-haired Yuppie Scum type on the line. Music BLARES. People dance in background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What room am I in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is the front desk, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Yuppie turns away from the phone and speaks to Real  Theodore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What room are we in?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How should I know? I just got here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) You know, don't you have one of those  light things?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you care to go to the door and  look on the other side, you'll find  the room number.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Real Theodore) Call my assistant and ask her what  floor we're on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's your assistant?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The girl you party with every night.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to himself) Who?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm here alone, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's room 404, I think.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have sworn we were on the  fifth floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right. 404.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Right. 404.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Real Theodore) What do we need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) Ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah. Ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Right, sir. Ice. 404. I'll be with  you momentarily.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted saunters down a hallway with a butt hanging out the c of his mouth and a bucket of ice swinging at his side. He pulls up at a door on which the faded numbers read someth like "Room 404." Ted knocks on the door. After a moment, the latch is thro and the door swings open. Ted cautiously steps into the d room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anybody home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A DEMONIC CACKLE cuts through the darkness.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one here but us chickens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say, it's pretty dark in here, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you expect, Theodore, a  fuckin' floor show?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In a flash the lights switch on and Ted finds himself sta down the barrel of a pretty intense-looking .357 Magnum,  cocked and ready to fire. At the other end of the gun sta a 50-year-old man, Sigfried, who sports a Cheshire Cat sm and a "just try fuckin' with me" look on his face. Sigfri isn't the only person in the room. Directly behind him si a beautiful young woman, Angela, gagged and bound to a ch Ted drops the bucket to the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I brought your ice.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's cute. In fact, the whole  getup's kind of cute. The monkey  suit's a nice touch, honey puss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This has to be a mistake. Is this  room 404?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Theodore? What do you take me for,  Theodore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A very upset man?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried reaches in his pocket and throws a handful of  assorted stimulants into his mouth, chewing on them like  they were breath mints. Sigfried thrusts his hand forward gripping Ted by the throat, and leads him to Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Angela) I am an upset man, Theodore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How do you know my name, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm psychic, Theodore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look my name is Ted, actually, and I  have no idea what's going on here,  but I've obviously come at a bad  time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's not belabor the fact that you  have no sense of timing, Theodore.  The fact is you're here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried turns to Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) And I couldn't think of a better  time for you to introduce me to your  beau than on New Year's Eve.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh fuck, there's a mistake. You're  fucking wrong here. My name is  Theodore, yes! My mother named me  that and I hate the name. But I'm a  fucking bellhop. People call me Ted.  I work here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Suddenly, with great force, Sigfried slams the butt of hi pistol smack into Ted's temple, sending him to the floor. Ted looks up at Sigfried in shock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'd love to sit here all night  with you talking about things like  when you broke in your first mitt -- (pause) That was insensitive of me, wasn't  it, T H E O D O R E? But let's cut  to the chase, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So apologize!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tense silence fills the room. All eyes are on Ted, who  can't figure out what the fuck this guy wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried looks hard with disbelief at Ted, who winces bac

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are really beginning to annoy  me, Theodore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried throws another handful of pills into his mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, obviously you two are working  something out and if I could help  you with your problem I would.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you saying? Are you saying  I got a problem? Are you trying to  say I don't give her what she needs?  That I'm FUCKING INSENSITIVE!!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, is this about another man? Or  something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted has struck a raw nerve. Sigfried's mood swings  drastically; he bends down next to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's get our ABC's right, here,  Theodore. Theodore, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted's better.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted, okay... Are you saying my wife  cheats on me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't say that... I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, for Christ's sake, Theodore,  this is about as intimate a situation  as you can get, you, me, and Angela  here. It's pretty cozy. To say nothing  of how stupid an idea it is to lie  to a man with a loaded gun without  considering the possible response. I  demand an apology!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The phone rings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't move. I've got to take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried glances at it. Then to Angela. He picks up the p

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (into phone) What? (pause) We ain't got any needles here, kid.  Just a big fucking gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He listens to the other line, says good-bye, and hangs up

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (to Ted) Now, where was I? Oh yeah, I remember.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried kneels next to Ted and assumes a prayer position

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want you to pray for forgiveness,  Theodore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried, hands clasped together, signals for Ted to do t same. The gun lies at his side. Ted considers a bold move but thinks better of it. Sigfried's eyes pop open. He cut look to Ted, signaling him to assume the pose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Now say after me, "I apologize..."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I apologize...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted looks to Angela for help. She can only stare back wit intense, wide-open eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For fucking what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That I said you might have been  unfaithful?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: "That I said you might have been  unfaithful?" Listen, Theodore, you're  in church here... you're kneeling in  front of an altar. Truth... truth is  all it hears. Say the following, "I,  Theodore, must humbly and sincerely  apologize for saying that you fucked  another man!"

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted repeats what Sigfried has told him. This appears to h a calming effect on Sigfried, who gets up off the floor,  turning his face to Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Satisfied?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela nods.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Do you accept the fucking apology?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally, Angela says nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) You always gotta get the last word,  don't you? It's one way with you,  Angela, isn't it? I give and I give  and I get nothing back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried turns to Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) She just sits there waiting for me  to jump through hoops...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Angela attempts to speak through the gag. Both men wait w bated breath for a response. Sigfried's had enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) Stupid me, for a second I thought  you were going to say something...  something like, "I'm sorry." HA!  "I'm sorry." You're absolutely right,  love cakes, I wouldn't want it that  way. That's one thing you can say  about Angela. She'll never do anything  she doesn't want to do. If the feeling  ain't there, she just isn't going to  do it. There is nothing in this world  as fucked as a woman who gives when  she doesn't want to. Never let that  happen to you, Theodore. It makes  you feel very little indeed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted beckons Sigfried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You mind if I...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead. Spit it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean to upset you further,  sir, but I think she was trying to  say yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you condescending to me, Theodore?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely not, I would never do  that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why don't you just say it?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Say what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That you think I'm an idiot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I would never say that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think you're superior to me,  don't ya, Theodore? You don't think  I notice there is a gag in the woman's  mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course you do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naturally "of course." And do you  know how I know that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How, sir?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because I PUT THE GAG IN HER MOUTH!  I'm gonna let you in on a little  secret about communication, Theodore.  It's all in the eyes... (points the gun at  Ted) Him? (turns the gun on  himself) Or me? Him or me? No one? Okay. Let's  drag it out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried empties the last of the pills into his mouth, he the empty bottle over his shoulder. He takes off, disappe into the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted finds himself alone with Angela. They lock eyes. Ange implores Ted to lean forward. Ted sizes up the situation: His chances of making it to the door are slim due to the  fact that he would have to pass by the bathroom door. Ted paces back and forth in front of Angela, who struggles to get his attention. He whips around and they face off in w appears to be a game of charades. Ted finally gets the po and cautiously removes the gag from Angela's mouth. Angel spits an old sock out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have time to play charades  here, asshole! Untie me quick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Listen, lady, I don't know what in  the hell is going on here, but I'd  appreciate it if you would explain  to that nutcase that he's making a  big mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, whether you like it or not,  you're in the middle of a situation  here you can't just wish your way  out of.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I've never seen you people before,  we're complete strangers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everyone starts out strangers, Ted,  it's where we end up that counts.  Hurry up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted wrestles with the idea of whether to untie Angela or  not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know if I can do this. It's  too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life is hard, Ted. You ever stopped  to consider how many times you change  your underwear in a lifetime?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On nervous impulse, Ted begins the calculations.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't mean literally, you ignoramus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Forget it, listen to me. There's a  gun in my suitcase behind the bed,  it's loaded...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not going to shoot anybody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fine. Get the gun and I'll shoot  "anybody."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And make me an accessory in the murder  of your husband?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted collapses to his knees in front of Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair. It just isn't fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a fucking grip on yourself. First  off, who says he's my husband? And  second, we are a long way from fair  here, fair is back in jolly old  England eatin' crumpets and sipping  on tea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted collects himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tut. Tut. Tut. Not so fast. Well,  maybe there are two sides to this  thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are two sides to a plate, still  you only eat off of one. Now GET THE  GUN!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So why's he got you tied up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a werewolf, Ted! Get the gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted is at a loss as to what to do. Angela turns on the ch

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on, Ted. Come over here just  for a minute. You can do it. Come  on, Ted. You look like a good guy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted creeps towards her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's it, Teddy. You look so much  more attractive when you're self- assured.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried suddenly comes to life... He's heard from the  bathroom belting out "Life is but a dream... she-boom, sh boom."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (she panics) Quick, he's coming back. Put the gag  back in, and remember the gun!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted hurries to replace the sock in her mouth.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nine thousand, three hundred and  twenty-two times, to the best of my  estimation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried coughs, sending a chill up Ted's spine. Ted whip around to discover Sigfried leaning up against the door t the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just beginning to think I could  trust you, Theodore. Silly me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted's fingers are frozen over Angela's lips.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just trying to help her breathe  a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't let me stop you, Teddy. You  don't mind me calling you Teddy, do  you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I used to have a little bunny rabbit  named Teddy, it looked real cute  nibbling on Angela's ear. Only problem  here is you're no bunny rabbit,  Theodore, and it really fuckin' razzes  me to picture you doin' it. But don't  let me stop you, Teddy... no need to  play sneaky-poo.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted starts to back toward the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, man, if this is some kind of  Voodoo thing and you want me to have  sex with your wife, there is  absolutely no way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouts at the top of  his lungs) I said, nibble, asshole! Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The directness of Sigfried's command, coupled with the SO of a trigger being cocked, forces Ted to approach Angela. Angela is a stunning beauty, and Ted being kind of a shy makes for an awkward situation. Ted leans forward. As he  closes in, Angela's eyes close.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (whispers) Sorry, lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted pulls up short of actually nibbling on Angela.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's the matter, no whiz left in  the cheese? I'm not cramping your  style, am I?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look, I'm not playing this game  anymore.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried yanks Ted backwards. He wraps his arms around hi

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's almost all over, Theodore, and  soon you can go home to Mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted struggles to free himself from Sigfried's powerful be hug and blasts out the following monologue.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is not Theodore, it's TED,  TED, TED, T... E... D... TED... NOT  TEDDY, NOT THEODORE... TED... Yes,  my mother did me the service of naming  me Theodore and I haven't a clue as  to how you know that because everyone  who knows that lives a long way away  from here. Do you have any idea what  it's like to go to school where all  the other kids' parents are in jail  doing time for crimes like grand  larceny, aggravated assault, burglary  and murder, and you get stuck with a  mother who names you Theodore and  dressed you up in little matching  pink outfits with, get this, a little  blue bow fucking tie! Well, I'll  tell you what happens. Pretty soon  Theodore becomes "Theo the Thumper,"  and when Theo the Thumper gets old  enough, he packs his bags and goes  thousands of miles away where he can  put the whole bloody mess behind  him. So, if you don't mind, shoot me  now, because no one is going to call  me that again. My name is Ted, okay?  Got it? TED!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried has followed the entire tirade in stunned silenc He takes a step toward Ted and offers him his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My name is Sigfried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried cuts a "Something wrong with that?" look at Ted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yah, Sigfried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nice to meet you, Sigfried.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted cautiously takes Sigfried's hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Very impressive, Ted. "Theo the  Thumper?"... Ouch. It's a deal, kid.  Ted it will be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried holds onto Ted's hand. The soft sound of distant fireworks pops in the background. Car horns and a muffled countdown signal that it's New Year's. Sigfried moves uncomfortably close to Ted and from out of nowhere bolts forward, planting a wet kiss right on Ted's mouth. Something snaps in Sigfried. He is either really  getting off on this or he is caught in the grips of a sei He doubles back on the floors. Ted and Angela watch as he flops around like a flounder with the cocked gun waving a over the place. Ted wipes his mouth with his jacket sleev while trying to dodge the barrel of the gun.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You okay, mister? I'll get help!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried manages to steady the gun and point it directly Ted. He signals for Ted to go to the bathroom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (continuing) That's the wrong door, sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sigfried grabs Ted by the leg and shove the barrel of the gun into his crotch. Sigfried pulls Ted's face closer to his.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get me the nitro... it's in the  bathroom cabinet. Now!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted rushes into the bathroom, leaving Sigfried a babbling mess behind.

dialogues.speaker: INT. BATHROOM--SAME TIME
dialogues.text: Ted enters the bathroom, which appears shaken by an  earthquake. Towels and wet clothes are all over the place An evening gown is flushed halfway down the toilet and pi are everywhere. Sigfried is shouting from the other room hurry. Ted checks the cabinet, searching for a bottle mar "Nitro." No luck. Ted spots a small window set above the toilet. He figures this is the best chance he's got to make a bre Ted goes for it. He manages to get his head and one arm  through the window before he gets stuck. His legs dangle the bathroom. Struggle as he may, he can only hit the toi bowl lever, which sends a loud FLUSH SOUND out through th apartment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (shouting in the  distance) It's no time to take a leak, Teddy,  I'm fucking dying here!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Outside the window, Ted's in another world. He's almost s It's a strange feeling, kind of like bathing in warm wate in paradise, knowing a huge shark is ready to rip his ass off. He can see the flickering red glowing light from the witches' room from the floor below.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ted sees Eva bopping naked past the window. He shouts her name out, to no avail. The MUSIC drowns out his voice and they ignore his calls help. The blood rushes to his head. He lets himself hang  there for a moment. He wonders how many other people have found themselves in situations like this before him. Prob everyone. Right next to his face, Ted recognizes a bloody hand print. It's not his blood.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
